result.execSummary:
The defendant Khamoni N Wood was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting/Failing to Stop, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(2t).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Consecutive to any sentence with credit for 2 days served; TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

Court waives all nonmandatory cost, fees and surcharges due to indigency. 
Court orders defendant to pay all cost, fees and surcharges, including DNA surcharge by December 31st, 2022 or a civil judgment to be entered with tax intercept.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Khamoni N Wood

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Khamoni N Wood appeared by video.  Attorney Helmi Hamad appeared by video for Khamoni N Wood.  Attorney David T. Malone in court for State of Wisconsin. 
The defendant has complied with the Deferred Prosecution Agreement.

AS TO COUNT 1:
On motion of the state, the court amended the charge to Resisting/Failing to Stop, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section 346.04(2t), a misdemeanor.   Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction to the amended charge.

Court sentenced defendant to serve 2 DAYS in the House of Correction CONSECUTIVE to any sentence with credit for 2 days served; TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.
Court waives all nonmandatory cost, fees and surcharges due to indigency. 
Court orders defendant to pay all cost, fees and surcharges, including DNA surcharge by December 31st, 2022 or a civil judgment to be entered with tax intercept. 

Court advised defendant of right to seek postconviction relief.
Received and Filed. DPA Essay
Received and Filed. Traffic Safety Course Completion
received and filed, Community Service Completion Letter
Received and Filed.
Received and Filed, Proof of 15 hours community service
Received and Filed, Driver Safety Course client will attend

Defendant Khamoni N Wood in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Khamoni N Wood appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy Court Clerk: AMI
Mid Point Review. 
Defendant completed 15 hours of community service. Defendant will be attending Driver Safety Course. Defendant needs to complete essay.   Based upon the defendant's compliance with the Deferred Prosecution Agreement, matter is adjourned for Final Review Hearing.
  Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to branch 17, Judge Carolina Stark, in Room 400 of the Courthouse.  Review hearing scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Received and Filed, Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel
Review hearing scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Khamoni N Wood in court with Attorney Ashley Fard.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties appear in person.
Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the Defendant guilty and WITHHOLDS entry of judgment of conviction into the record.

Early Intervention Program Deferred Prosecution Agreement received and filed.  Court orders case adjourned for review hearing.  Case adjourned for review hearing before Judge C. Davis, Branch 21, per Chief Judge Directive.
Clerk:  jms
Early Intervention Program Deferred Prosecution Agreement Public Defender's Office Representation - received
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement
Jury Instruction - filed with plea questionnaire
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for April 27, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Khamoni N Wood in court with Attorney Ashley Fard.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties appear in person.
Defense counsel advises Court she has received discovery and there is a likely deferred prosecution resolution to this case.
Court orders case adjourned for deferred prosecution hearing in Branch 28.

Clerk:  jms

Defendant Khamoni N Wood in court with Attorney Ashley Fard.  Matthew Zisi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Wauwatosa Officer B. Ziegler. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 28.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 2, 2022 at 09:00 am.

No driving without a valid license.
DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 1/27/2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant Khamoni N Wood in court with Attorney Ashley Fard.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge  Sanders, Branch 28.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 1/25/22 @ 2:30p
